element.name: Rooske Graveyard by rooske, Multi-cache (1/1.5)
element.description:
Multi cache near country graveyard
Stage 1: At the above co-ords take note of the day & month Michael died. Call this A,B, C, D
Stage 2: At co-ords 53.24.210n 006.28.306 Take note of Marys(who was never late) age. Call this E, F
Final co-ords: 53.24.C(E-A)E 006.28.(A+C)(E-E)(A+C+F)
element.long-description:
Tab Box containing log book & small trade items.
Additional Waypoints

ul.li:
2010-06-10T19:00:00Z : Found it by Serapis
Myself and the good wife were at a wedding in Dunboyne castle a few weeks ago and we decided to go for this. Why did we not find it? Well we forgot it. We were well on the way back to Waterford when I remembered it. How do you forget to find a cache? To much grog the night before, probably. Today I found it eventually after wandering around the graveyard avoiding the intense cleanup that was going on. Mary’s grave hasn’t had a trim yet and the strimmer man probably thought I was a bit strange (mad [;)]). The final co-ords were about 10 m off for me. I had to endure a few muggle infringes, including the a man in a BMX X5 who probably was the occupier of the nearby house, I got a bit of a stare as he waited for his gates to open. My Oregon 400 sometimes doubles up as a handy mobile phone. Had to do a bit of ‘where would I hide it’ sort of thing until it came up trumps. TNLNSL, Serapis.
This entry was edited by Serapis on Friday, 11 June 2010 at 01:04:58.

2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by orangetigerprawn
Oh Mary, oh, Mary, oh Mary!
The first stage was no bother, the trouble with Mary was finding her. Once that had been done the rest was a walk in the ... park.
Go raibh maith agat as an taisce.

2010-03-12T20:00:00Z : Found it by Maji
Quiet place, quick find TFTC

2010-03-02T20:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Found this one this evening with Blue Jay 59. As she said, you wouldn't want to be looking for Mary in the dark. Nice final hiding spot. TFTC Toffee Man #236

2010-03-02T20:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Found this one this evening easily enough, not too far from home either. Found Michael and then found the 3 Mary's. You'd want your glasses on to find the right Mary, wouldn't like to be looking for her in the dark.[:D] Congrats on your first cache hide. Nice one. Look forward to more. TFTC Blue Jay 59 #234

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text:
Myself and the good wife were at a wedding in Dunboyne castle a few weeks ago and we decided to go for this. Why did we not find it? Well we forgot it. We were well on the way back to Waterford when I remembered it. How do you forget to find a cache? To much grog the night before, probably. Today I found it eventually after wandering around the graveyard avoiding the intense cleanup that was going on. Mary’s grave hasn’t had a trim yet and the strimmer man probably thought I was a bit strange (mad [;)]). The final co-ords were about 10 m off for me. I had to endure a few muggle infringes, including the a man in a BMX X5 who probably was the occupier of the nearby house, I got a bit of a stare as he waited for his gates to open. My Oregon 400 sometimes doubles up as a handy mobile phone. Had to do a bit of ‘where would I hide it’ sort of thing until it came up trumps. TNLNSL, Serapis.
